list.item: First issue published by Perseus Digital Library on 07th April 2011

sense.s: wa: you say, saAra zayodN waEomorNw, using w as a conjunction; rather than waEamorFA: and sirotu wazayodFA, using w as [a prep.] denoting concomitance; rather than wazayodN. (I'Ak, p. 161.)

maA OumRiI waOumRuhu; and maA OanaA waTalabu AlwaHoXi: see OumRN: and see another ex. in a verse cited voce Halima. In the Kur, ii. 121 some read waUisomeEiylu; and others wUisomeEiyla. In maA laka wazayodFA, the w denotes concomitance; What hast thou in common, or to do, with Zeyd? or it is for maA laka wialzayoKd.
wa in whuwa laka: see HamodN.
AlwaAwu limuTolaqi AljamoEi [The w denoting unrestricted conjunction, not necessarily implying simultaneousness nor relative order]. (I'Ak, p. 254.)
waA generally means Alas! see waA HarabaA, and the last verse voce HatRaI.

s.hi: Alas, Zeyd!

sense.s: waA daforaAho, and waAnitonaAho, Alas, stench! meaning Alas, what an abominable thing! See daforN; and OabN.
1: The verse of Lebeed,

means She carries off from the gazelle entering his covert, he not being frightened by her. the branch of the trunk of the tree above him, when the shade contracts, or decreases, or goes away, at midday: he is describing his swift she-camel.
10. AisotawoCara He hasted in the darkness; as also AstOwr. (K, art. Owr.)
1. waOala: see Mla, in art. Awl, in two places.
OawRalu First, and former; preceding all others, and preceding another. See art. Owl
OawaAYilu AlsRuwari The first parts, or beginnings, of the chapters of the Kur-án.
jaMCa fiI OawaAYili Alqawomi He came among the first comers of the people. (Msb.)
And AlOawaAYilu The people of former ages; as also AlOawRaluwna.

laqiytuhu EaAmFA OawRala means I met him [in a former year.] before this year, though by several years. (Alee El-Kári, in his Expos. of the K, from Seer; cited in the margin of a copy of the K; art. Awl.) See EaAmN.
3: See art. wmO.
wiYaAmN The being mutually near; mutually agreeing. (T, voce tawoCamN.)
AltRawoCamaAni, The herb so called: see art. tOm.

1. waOaI as syn. with waEada; imperative Uih. with the h of silence added; fem. corroborated form of the imperative UinRa; of which last, see a curious ex. in the end of article HarofN AlOalifi, in the Mughnee.
1. wubirati AlnRaxolapu [The palm-tree was fecundated:] i. q. Oubirato, i. e. OuloqiHato. (Aboo-'Amr Ibn-El-'Alà, in L, art. Obr.) See art. Obr.
4. OawobaruwA EalaI XaIoCK i. q. AwSbwA Elyh, q. v. (TA, art. wSb.)
naxolapN mawobuwrapN i. q. maOobuwrapN. (Aboo-'Amr Ibn-El- 'Alà, l. e.)
waboXN A whiteness on the nails: see zinojiyr.
1. wabala He (a horse) ran vehemently: see an ex. in a verse cited voce daAma, in art. dwm.
wabolN Violent rain, consisting of large drops; as also waAbilN↓; (K;) a heavy rain.
bulapN: see UibaAlapN.
wabalapN: see OabalapN.
wabaAlN An evil result. (Msb.)
wabiylapN: see UibaAlapN.
waAbilN: see wabolN.

waAbilapN The extremity [in which is the glenoid cavity] of the scapula: and the portion of flesh [or muscle] of the scapula. (IAar, T.) See marodagapN, and also DadafN; and more particularly Ainofaraka.
1. maAwabahotu lahu, and wabihotu: see maA Oabahotu lh
1. wabuwati AlOaroDu wabiyati AlOaroDu: see wbiYat.
4. maACN laA yuwbiI: see wbO.
watarapN The vein (Eiroq [meaning the frenum]) that is in the inner side (baATin) of the glans of the penis. (S, K, and Zj, in his “ Khalk el-Insán. ”)
mawotuwrN: see voce vaOorN.

Alwatiynu [The aorta: or the aorta descendens:] a certain vein [or artery] adhering to the inner
side of the backbone all along, which supplies all the [other] veins [or arteries] with blood, and irrigates the flesh, being the river of the body: or a certain thick white vein resembling a cane: [this last is the description given by Zj in his “ Khalk el-Insán: ”] or [the aorta ascendens;] the niyaAT of the heart: or a certain white vein within the back of the neck: it is said to draw up [its supply] from the heart, and in it is the blood.
Also, the xilob, q. v.: pl. OawotinapN and wutunN: (M:) i. q. niyaATu Alqalobi. (Bd, and Jel, lxix. 45.) See Oaboharu.
3. waAtaAhu EalaI AlOamori, inf. n. muwaAtaApN and witaMCN, i. q. TaAwaEahu; a dial. var. of the verb with C [i. e. MtaAhu, q. v., and of waATaOahu also]. (TA.) See 3 in art. Edw.
4. OawotaI: see watRN.
mstwtI, or musotawotK A mare desirous of the stallion: see musotaOotK in art. AtI.
AltRawaAviyru i. q. OaEowaAnu AlrRajuli. (TA, in art. Aml.)
1. wavuqa It was, or became, firm, stable, fast, or strong; (Msb;) i. q. OuHokima (S, Mgh, K) [or AisotaHokama, q. v.].
waviqa bihi He trusted, or confided, in him. (S, Mgh, Msb, K.)
4. Oawovaqahu He made it firm, stable, fast, or strong. (Msb.)
He bound, or tied, him, or it, firmly, fast, or strongly, in a bond. (S, K, TK.) See XadRahu.
5. tawavRaqati AlEuqodapu [The knot became firm, or fast]. (A, in art. Arb.)
10. Aisotawovaqa minohu [He secured himself against him, by a bond or the like, or absolutely:] he took, or received, a bond (waviyqap) from him. (S, K.)
Oukotubuwhu QsotiyvaAqFA wadafoEFA lilnRizaAEi [Write ye it, (namely, the debt,) for the creditor's self-securing, and for preventing contention]. (Jel, ii. 282.) See AisotaZohara.
Aisotawovaqa mina AlbaAbi He closed the door firmly. (MA.)
Aisotawovaqa mino Oumuwrihi: see OaEonaja.
Aisotawovaqa mina AlmaAli: see Astwvj.

s.hi: He confided in him.

sense.s: viqapN Trusty; trustworthy; honest: applied as an epithet alike to a man and a woman, and to two or more men or women: pl. viqaAtN. (Msb.)
bihi viqatiI In him is my trust, or confidence. (TA.)
lasotu minohu EalaI viqapK I am not confident, or sure, of it. Occurring in the S, art. Dmr, &c. See an ex. voce XahorN (last sentence).
Oaxuw viqapK: see OaxN.
Oaxaca biAlvRiqapi: see Oaxaca, and see my explanation of UiHotaATa.
Alwaviyqapu fiI AlOamori The doing the thing firmly; and taking the sure method, or way; expl. by UiHokaAmuhu wAlOaxocu biAlviRaqapi. (TA.)
waviyqapN A bond, security, or writing of obligation for the payment of a debt or the like: pl. wavaAYiqu. Ex., kitobapu AlwavaAYiqi (Bd, ii. 282,) The mode of writing bonds.

s.hi: A pledge.

sense.s: waviyqapN i. q. durojapN, q. v.
Oaxaca AlOamora biAlOawovaqi He set about the affair in the surest, or firmest, manner. (TA.)
mawoviqN and miyvaAqN↓ A compact; a contract; a covenant; an agreement; a league; a treaty; an engagement; a bond; an obligation; a promise. (S, K, &c.)
miyvaAqN: see mawoviqN; and Jel, &c., in ii. 60 and 87.
mawovuwqN bihi In whom [and in which] trust, or confidence, is placed. (Mgh.)
muwavRaqapu Alxaloqi A she-camel rendered firm, strong, or compact, in make. (S.)
waviymapN Broken stones. (TA, art. jrm.) See jaraAmN.
wavanN An idol: see SanamN and EavanN and EananN.
wavoIN: see wavoCN.
1. wajiEa raOosahu He had a pain in his head: see Oalma.
4. OawojaEahu He, or it, pained him; or caused him pain, or aching. (K, MA, TA.)

5. tawajRaEa He expressed, or manifested, pain, affliction, distress, grief, or sorrow; [complained; moaned; or] uttered lamentation, or complaint; (PS;) syn. taOalRama. (S, art. Olm) and tafajRaEa (S, art. fjE; and K) and taXakRaI (Msb, K) and taOawRaha (Msb, art. Awh) and OahRa (S, art. Oh) and taHazRana. (K, art. Hzn.)
tawajRaEa lahu mino kacaA [He was pained for him, or he lamented for him, on account of such a thing]; he pitied him for such a thing. (S, Msb, K.)
tawajRaEa lilomuSiybapi [He lamented for the affliction, or calamity]. (K, art. fjE.)

s.hi: He lamented, complained, or expressed pain, or grief, to him, on account of such a thing.

sense.s: wajaEN A disease, or malady, (S, Msb, K, TA,) of any kind, (Msb,) causing pain. (TA.)
wajaEu AlmafaASili Pain of the joints; i. e. arthritis: see niqorisN.
jiEapN The nbyc, or beverage, made from barley: see mizorN.
AlwajoEaMCu The anus: see a verse cited voce OafodaEu.
wajonapN The ball, or elevated part, of the cheek. (S, Msb, K.)
2. wajRahoti sijaAfatahu sidaAfatahu; i. e. hatakoti sitorahu, i. e. Oaxacoti wajohahaA: see arts. sjf and sdf, and jwh, conj. 2.

3. waAjahahu, inf. n. muwaAjahapN, He faced him; confronted him; encountered him; met him face to face (S, K, Msb.) He confronted him, accosted him, or encountered him, with speech, or words, or with his face. (Lth, JK, TA.)
4. Oawojaha He repelled, or rejected, an asker, or a beggar. (T.)
See jwh.
5. tawajaRha He tended, repaired, or betook himself, to, or towards, him, or it, either in a direct course, or indirectly. (IJ, in M and L, art. qSd.)
OaHomaqu maAyatawajRahu A stupid man, who does not accomplish his affair well. (JK.)

8. lamo yatRajiho liXaIoCK (S, K, art. bwr; and M, K, art. bld; &c.) He did not apply himself rightly to anything; he knew not the right course to pursue; like lamo yahotadi. See also OaHomaqu maA yatawajRahu; and see baAYirN and gumRaI.
AitRajaha lahu raOoIN i. q. sanaHa. (S, TA.) See sanaHa, in two places.

s.hi: He became convalescent.

sense.s:
Oasolamotu wajohiI llReh I resigned, or resign, myself to God: i. e., I became, or become, *
Muslim: wjh is here used for the whole because it is the most noble part: (Jel, ii. 106:) or cAtI my course. (TA.)
mino kulRi wajohK In every respect; considered from every point of view.
Alwajohu Oano yakuwna kacaA The [proper or reasonable] way is that it should be thus: or the valid and obvious [way]. (Msb.) See turoEapN.
wajohN A course, a purpose, or an object, which one is pursuing; a direction in which one is going or looking, & c. as also jihapN↓.
The way of a thing. (TA.)
layosa likalAamika wajohN There is no truth, or correctness, in thy saying. (TA.)
wajohN Brightness [of intellect]. (L, voce kadRN.)
liwajohi QllRehi (Kur, lxxvi. 9) For the sake of God; or to obtain the countenance or favour of God. (Kull, p. 378.) See fiI caAti QllRehi in art. cuw.

s.hi: Were it so, it were reasonable.

sense.s: laA wajoha lahu, said of a phrase, &c., There is no reasonable way of accounting for it.
laysa biAlwajohi same as layosa biwajiypK? Not of respectable, or esteemed, or high, authority: (said of a word or phrase, &c.:) or it is not the proper way.

AibotigaACa wajohi AllRehi From a desire of God's recompense: (Kur, ii. 274; and Expos. of the Jeláleyn:) or countenance, meaning favour. There are several similar phrases in the Kur, where wjh is explained in the same sense of vawaAbN in the Expos. of the Jeláleyn.
jabasahu Eano wajohihi [He withheld him, or restrained him, from his course, purpose, or object]. (S, art. Alt.)
Sarafa AlXRaIoCa Eano wajohuhu He turned the thing away, or back, from its course, Eano sananihi. (TA.)
xaraja wajohuhu (S, A, L, art. mrd; and L voce AstElj;) [for xaraja nabaAtu wajohihi, The hair of his face grew forth].
wajohu AldRahori The beginning of time, (K,) and nahaArK of day. (TA.)
rawaAhu EalaI wajohihi, (S, K, art. qS,) and HadRava bihi EalaI wajohihi: (Msb, art. qS:) see qaSRa, in two places.
Oatayotu AlOamora mino wajahihi, &c., and jihatihi↓: see maOotFI.
wajohN The drift of speech. (K, Kull, p. 378.)
maDaIa EalaI wajohihi [He went at random, heedlessly, headlong, or in a heedless, or headlong, course, or manner; and so cahaba EalaI wajohihi]: see rakiba raOosahu in art. rkb.
dahaba EalaI wajohihi Hayovu XaMCa [He went away at random whither he would]. (TA in art. swm.)
balRato maTiyRatuhu EalaI wajohihaA and OabalRato: see 1 in art. bl.
OuTolubuwA AlHawaAYija UinaI HisaAni Alwujuwhi Make ye petition, for the things that ye want, to persons of good rank or station. (El-Hasan El-Muäddib, in TA, art. nDr.)
wajohN (assumed tropical:) Consideration and regard. See 3 in art. Asw.

wajohN and jihapN↓ The place towards which one goes: (Munjid of Kr:) or the place, region, quarter, part, or point, towards which a person, or thing, goes, tends, or is directed: so I have rendered jihapN↓: see SuqoEN, and masojuwHN: jihapN↓ signifies any place towards which one looks or goes; as also wijohupN↓: (Har, p. 373:) the place, or point, of the tendency or direction or bearing of anything: whence kacaA jihapa↓ in the direction of such a thing: and lijihapK↓ towards one quarter.

Hence, wajohu AlTRariyqi The point, or place, to which the way, or road, leads: see canaAbapN. And in like manner, wajohu OamorK and jihatuhu↓ The end, or result, of an affair, to which it leads, or tends.
ramawoA wajohFA waAHidFA [They shot in one direction]. (M voce riXoqN.)
wajohu AlDRuHaI The first, or beginning, of the DuHaI. (TA voce rawonaqN, q. v.)
wajohN A chief of a people or party. (K.)
OatawoA mano wajohihimo: see faworN.
wajohN i. q. TariyqapN [meaning The mode, or manner, of a thing]. (KL.)

s.hi: I know not what is its meaning.

sense.s: Oaxaca wajohahaA [app. He degraded her; took away her grade: and hence he took her maidenhead: see wajRahoti sijaAfatahu].
jahapN: see wajohN throughout.
mino jihapi kacaA In respect of, or with reference to, such a thing: and by reason, or on account, or because, of such a thing.
AljihaAtu AlsRitu The six relative points or directions or locations; namely, above, below, before, behind, right, and left.
wijohapN: see wajopN.
A way, mode, or manner, of acting, &c.

s.hi: Worthy of regard.

sense.s: Oawojahu More, and most, worthy of regard.
tawojiyhN: see walovN.
AltRawojiyhu i. q. AltRaworiyapu.
mutawajRahN A place towards which one tends, repairs, or betakes himself.

1. wajiIa and tawajRaI↓ [said of a man, or of a horse or the like, or of a camel] His foot, or hoof, or firosin, was, or became, attenuated, and chafed, or abraded: (TA:) or he (a horse) experienced a pain in his hoof. (S.)
5: see 1.
muwHajN: transp. for muwjiHN.
5. tawaHRafa quasi-pass. of OatoHafahu: see tuHofapN.
8. AitRaHafahu: see art. tHf.
wuHofapN and wuHafapN, said to be the originals of tuHofupN and tuHafapN: see tuHofapN.
waHalN (S. Msb, K) and waHolN (Msb, K) Slime, mire, or then mud, (S, Msb, K,) in which beast of carriage slick. (K.)
1. waHamito She was incompliant to the male: see an ex. voce Xagaba.
HinapN: see UiHonapN.
4. OawoHaI Uilayohi He (God) revealed to him; or spake, or made known, to him by revelation
Also, He suggested to him; or put into his mind. (Mughnee voce Oano.)
waHiIRN Hasty; (K;) quick; (S, Mgh, Msb, K; applied in this sense to death. (S, Mgh, Msb.)
AlwaHaMCa AlwaHaMCa [Make thou] haste; or haste to be first, or before, or beforehand: haste; &c. (S, TA.)
fiI OawoHaI mudRapK In the shortest period: see an ex. in the first paragraph of art. vqf.

1. waxafahu He beat it (namely xiTomiIR, IDrd, K, and in like manner sawiyq, IDrd) with his hand, and moistened it in a TXt [or basin], (TA,) until it became viscous, or cohesive, (K, TA,) and became [fit for] food; (TA;) as also Oawoxafahu↓ (K) and waxRafahu↓. (TA.)
2: see 1.
4: see 1.

10. Aisotawoxamahu He found it (food) to be unwholesome; as also tawaxRamahu↓: (JK, K:) he found it (a land) to be insalubrious: (TA:) he found it (a country or town) to disagree with
its inhabitants. (S, Msb.)
maA Oasotawoximu Oano OaSoHabaka: see 5 in art. jdb.
waxomN A heavy person (K) [i. e., dull].
waxamN A tainted condition of the air, engendering pestilential diseases. (TA.)
waxiymN Unwholesome food: (Mgh:) unsuitable food. (K.)
3. waAxaAhu: see MxaAhu.
5. tawaxRaAhu He sought it, aimed at it, or purposed it: (S, Mgh, Msb, K:) and he sought it, &c., exclusively of, or in preference to, any other thing. (Mgh.)

1. waduEa, (S, K,) inf. n. wadoEN and daEapN, (TA,) He (a man, S,) or it, (a thing, TA,) became still, quiet, or at rest; (S, K, TA;) as also AitRadaEa↓, (K, TA,) [quasi-] inf. n. tudoEapN and tudaEapN. (TA.) You say to a man, AinRadaEo↓ and tawadRaEo↓ meaning Be thou grave, staid, steady, sedate, or calm. (TA.) See also 1; and art. wcr.
waduEa and wadaEa, inf. n. wadaAEapN, He was, or became, in a state of ease, and ampleness of the means or circumstances of life. (Msb.)
daEo: see an ex. voce McaI: it may be rendered, in different cases, Leave thou, or let alone, or say nothing of: see baloha.
daEoniI mino kacaA Let me alone and cease from such a thing: and exempt thou me, or excuse me, from such a thing.
daEo Eanoka kacaA Dismiss thou from thee such a thing. See xuco Eanoka.
daEo maA yariybuka UilaI laA yariybuka: see art. ryb.
daEo maA zayodN: see siIRN in art. swI.
wadaEa used as a pret.: see an ex. voce zaAYilapN, in art. zwl.
2. wadRaEahu, (MA,) inf. n. tawodyEN, (PS,) He bade farewell to him. (MA, PS.)

3. waAdaEahu, inf. n. muwaAdaEapN, and subst. widaAEN, He made peace or reconciled himself, with him: (Msb:) [the inf. n.] muwaAdaEapN is syn. with muSaAlaHapN because it is mutaArakapN [a mutual leaving, or leaving unmolested]. (Mgh.)

muwaAdaEapN is also syn. with tarokN; as also daEapN↓: (TA:) so that waAdaEahu signifies He left him: but more correctly, he left him, being left by him; like taArakahu, and xaAlaAhu; and this is the primary meaning.
5: see 1.
6. tawaAdaEaA They two made peace, or became reconciled, each with the other. (K.)
7: see 1.
8. AitRadaEa: see 1: he acted, or proceeded, with moderation, without haste or hurry, in his pace or journeying. (M in art. Awn.)

10. AisotawodaEahu maAlFA He intrusted him with property; intrusted to him property; gave property to him in trust, or as a deposit. (Msb.) And AisotawodaEahu wadiyEapF He asked him to keep, preserve, guard, or take care of, a deposit. (K.)

daEapN Ease; repose; freedom from trouble or inconvenience, and toil or fatigue; tranquillity; syn. xafoDN (S. Mgh, K, TA) and raAHapN (Mgh, Msb, TA) and sukuwnN; (TA;) and ampleness of circumstances (saEapN) in life: (K:) or daEapN is syn. with rAHp and skwn; but xafoDN signifies “ ampleness of the circumstances ” (saEahRN) of life, and “ plentifulness and pleasantness ” thereof: [see an ex. of both, voce xafoDN]. (El-Marzookee and MF, art. xfD.)
See 1 and 3.
wadaEapN A cowry; Cypræa: see an ex. cited voce samRa.
wadiyEapN A thing committed to the trust and care of a person; a trust; a deposit. (Mgh, Msb.) See 10.
wadaAEN [Gravity, steadiness:] i. q. sakiynapN, [like mawoduwEN↓,] as also waqaArN. (S, L, in art. skn.)
And Valediction. (S, Msb.)
miydaEN and miydaEapN A garment, or piece of cloth, used as a repository for clothes. (TA.)
mawoduwEN: see wadaAEN, and see a verse cited voce maSodaq.
musotawodaEN A depository: see a verse cited voce ZilRN.
wadoqN Rain, (S, K, TA,) whether violent or gentle: (TA:) or violent rain. (MF in art. qhb.)
wadiyqN: see 10 in art. qrO.
mutawadRiqN: occurring in the TA, art. qhb; from Alwadoqu, meaning Violent rain. (MF.)
wadakN Grease, or gravy: i. e. the oily matter that is produced from flesh-meat; (TA;) or the dripping that exudes from flesh-meat and from fat. (Mgh, Msb.)
mawoduwnN: see maToluwlN.
1. wadaI Alqatiyla He gave the bloodwit to the heir, or next of kin, of the slain person. (Msb.)
3. waAdaAhu inf. n. muwaAdaApN, He took [from him] the diyap. (TA.) See 3 in art. Edw.
4. OawodaI bihi It destroyed him; (T;) it removed him, or took him away: (M, K:) said of death [&c.]. (T, M, K.) See an ex. in art. blw, conj. 8, and another voce Oazolamu.
OawodaI: see a verse cited voce qalabapN.
OawodaI AlEayoru UilRA DariTFA: see DaraTa.
diyapN Bloodwit; a fine for bloodshed, i. e., homicide; consisting of a hundred camels.
diyaAtu jiraAHaAtK [Fines for wounds]. (S, M, TA, &c., in art. Xnq.)
wadiIRN Small fasiyl, q. v.; (S, Msb, K;) shoots, or offsets, cut off from palm-trees and planted: (Mgh:) young palm-trees. (TA.)

waAdK [A valley; a water-course, or torrent-bed: and sometimes a river;] a space intervening, (M, Msb, K,) i. e. any such space, (M, Msb,) between mountains or hills; (M, Msb, K;) through which a torrent runs forth [occasionally or constantly]: (Msb:) for which reason it is thus called. (M, Mgh, TA.)
HalRa biwaAdiyhi i. q. baAEai EalaI bayoEihi in one of the senses explained in art. byE; i. e., (tropical:) He superseded him, &c.
tawodiyapN; pl. tawaAdK, in the accus. case, by poetic licence, tawaAdiyFA: see a verse cited voce xufRN.
4. Oawocama HajRFA: see an ex. voce dasimN.
wcm [app. wacamN] The villosity of a tripe. (TA, art. trb.)
1. waraEN Piety: or pious fear: syn. taqowaI: (K:) and abstinence from unlawful things. (TA.)
huwa waraEN DaraEN: see DaraEN.
1. warifa, and its inf. n. wariyfN: see rafRa, in two places.

wariqN Silver, whether coined or not: (AO,
TA:) or coined dirhems; (S, K;) coined silver. (Mgh.) See EayonN.
OaworaAq, pl. of waraqN, meaning OaHodaAv: see qaEobN.
wuroqapN Ash-colour. (Msb.) See sumorapN.
wariqapN and wariyqapN: see waAriqN.

XajarN waAriqN Trees having leaves: (Msb:) [or leafy trees; trees having many leaves; for] XajarapN waAriqapN (TA) and wariqapN↓ and wariyqapN↓ (S, K, TA) signify a tree having many leaves. (S, K, TA.) And XajarapN waAriqapu AlZRilaAli [A tree having leafy coverings or shades]. (K in art. gyl.)

Oaworaqu, applied to a camel, White inclining to black; i. e. of a dusky white hue: or rather, simply, duskish; or dusky; (S, K;) or of a colour like that of ashes. (T, Mgh, Msb.) See OaHomaru and xuTabaAniIRN.
Oaworaqu Ashes. (K.) See an ex. a verse cited voce EunRapN, last sentence.
warikN What is above the thigh; [the haunch; or hip; and often signifying only the hip-bone; and the hip as meaning the joint of the thigh?] (S, K, &c.)
maworikN of a camel's saddle: see 8 in art. Eql.

waralN: see DabRN: there are two species: waralu AlbaHori the wrl of the river; the monitor of the Nile; lacerta Nilotica: (see Forskål, Descr. Animalium, p. 13:) and waralu AlOaroDi the wrl of the land; the land monitor; lacerta scincus: vulg. pronounced waran.
1. warima Oanofuhu (tropical:) He became enraged: see OanofN.
4. Oaworamahu meaning Oarogamahu He angered him: see XaraAhu.
waramN, a coll. gen. n., Swellings, or tumours: n. un. with p. The n. un. occurs in the TA, art. jdr, &c.
warohaMCu AlrRaxami: see raxamN.
1. waraI, aor. yariI, inf. n. waroIN [and wuriIRN and riyapN, K]; and wariIa, aor. yariI; and OaworaI↓; It (a zanod) produced its fire. (Msb.)
wariyato bika zinaAdiI, or warato: see art. znd, and see waqada and zahara, and rAI.
qadoHN laA yuwriI: see xayRaAbN.

2. warRaI biXaIoCK Eano XaIoCK [He pretended, or made believe, a thing, instead of a thing which he meant: as is shown by the explanation of a trad. in the TA]. (S, art. ErD; save that the inf. n. is there mentioned instead of the pret.)

warRaI Eano kacaA, inf. n. taworiyapN, He alluded to such a thing equivocally, or ambiguously: equivocated respecting it: he meant such a thing and pretended another. (M, K.) Altwryp is also called AlUiyhaAmu and AltRawojiyhu and AltRaxoyiylu: (Kull, p. 113:) and signifies The using a word, an expression, or a phrase, which has an obvious meaning, and intending thereby another meaning, to which it applies, but which is contrary to the obvious one. (Msb.) See miEoraADN.
See 4.
3. waAraAhu He hid it, concealed it, or covered it. (S, Msb, K, &c.)
4. OaworaI and warRaI↓ and AisotaworaI↓ He made his znd to produce fire. (S, K.)
See 1.
waroIN Purulent matter in the interior of the body: or [an abscess; or] a severe ulcer that discharges purulent matter and blood. (M, K, TA.) waroyFA waquHaAbFA: see quHaAbN.
riyapN: see riYapN, in art. rOI.
waraAYiI kacaA Behind me is such a thing, as though it were a burden upon my back.
mino waraMCa waraMCa From behind a thing covering, or concealing. (TA.)
fulaAnN mino waraMCi fulaAnK Such a one is an aider of such a one: or a follower. (Ham, p. 206.)
AallRehu mino waraAYika God is seeking after thee, and watching, or lying in wait, for thee. (Ham, p. 206.) See also an ex. in the first paragraph of art. ftl.
AlnRaworaApu The Book of the Law revealed to Moses. (Bd, iii. 2; &c.)
AlwazaEapu i. q. OaEowaAnu AlrRajuli. (TA in art. Aml.) wAziEN: see faAriEN.
4. Oawozagati AlTRaEonapu biAldRami: see Oazogalat.

wazagapN A certain reptile (duwabbRapN); (S;) i. q. buroSN [a lizard of the species called gecko, of a leprous hue, as its name brS indicates]; (TA, art. brS;) and i. q. saAmRu OaboraS: (JK, M, K:) or sAmR AbrS is a name of the large wazag; (A and Msb, both in art. brS;) or is of the large wazag. (S and K. both in art. brS.)
1. wazana It (a thing) was heavy: (Msb:) or outweighed, or preponderated; syn. wajaHa. (TA.)
3. hecaA yuwaAzinu hecaA This is equiponderant to this. (S.)
8. AitRazanahu He took it, or received it, by weight. (S, * Mgh, Msb, K. *) See an ex. voce sanojapN.
Alwazonu A certain star in the left fore leg of Centaurus. (Kzw.) See HaDaAri.
ziniIRN, rel. n. of zinapN. (S, art. wEd, q. v., voce EidapN.)

waAzinN: see raAjiHN: heavy: (Msb:) or of full weight: (KL:) pl. wuzRanN: see zaAlRN. You say, dirohamN waAzinN (S) A full, or complete, dirhem: (so in a copy of the S:) [a dirhem of full weight: a heavy dirhem. (PS.)
wazRaAnN A weigher. (TA, in art. qsT.)
miyzaAnN A weighing-instrument; (TA:) a balance; a pair of scales.
The weight of a thing. (K, &c.) See mivoqaAlN.
3. waAzaAhu, inf. n. muwaAzaApN: see MzaAhu. See also 3 in art. qrO.
AlsRajoEu AlmutawaAziI A variety of rhyming prose: see sajoEN.
wasuwTN A middle-sized tent of goats hair: see miZalRapN.

1. wasiEa AlUinaMCu AlmataAEa [The vessel was sufficient in its capacity or dimensions, or sufficiently capacious, or large, for the goods]; and AlmakaAnu Alqawoma [the place for the company of men]. (Msb.) laA yasaEuka An tafoEala kacaA It is not in thy power, or proper for thee, (MA,) or allowable for thee, (Mgh, Msb,) to do such a thing. (MA, Mgh, Msb.)
wasaEa Ealayohi rizoqahu, aor. yawosaEu; and OawosaEahu↓, and wasRaEahu↓; He (God) made his means of subsistence ample and abundant. (Msb.)
2. wasRaEa He made wide, broad, spacious, roomy, or ample.
wasRaEa lahu fiI Almajolisi He made room, or ample space, for him in the sitting-place. (S, art. fsH.)
[And so] fiI Almajolisi tawaAsRaEuwA↓ They made room, or ample space, [one for another,] in the sitting-place. (S, art. fsH.)
wasRaEa Ealayohi, for wasRaEa Ealayohi rizoqahu, He (God) amplified, enlarged, or made ample or plentiful, his means of subsistence; contr. of DayRaqa.
See 1, and 4.

4. OawosaEahu AlXRaIoCa [He made, or rendered, the thing ample, or free from straitness, to him;] he made the thing sufficient for him; syn. jaEalahu yasaEuhu: (TA:) [he gave him sufficiently of the thing; or largely thereof.]
AallRehumRa OawosiEonaA raHomataka O God, make thy mercy sufficient for us; syn. AijoEalohaA tasaEunaA. (TA.)
OawosaEahu Oamorahu [He made, or rendered, his state, or case, or affair, ample, or free from straitness, to him]. (S, art. frX.) See faraXahu.
OawosaEuwA lilrRajuli They made room, or ample space, for the man, in a place of standing or of sitting. (Msb, voce faraja.)
OawosaEa Ealayohi, (S, K.) and wasRaEa↓, (K,) He (God) enriched him; or rendered him free from want. (S, K.)
See 1.
5. tawasRaEa [He became, or made himself, ample, or abundant, in his circumstances; or in his means of subsistence; for twsRE fiI EayoXihi;] i. q. tarafRaga. (S, in art. rfg.)
tawasRaEa He took a wide, an ample, or a large, range, fiI OamorK, in an affair.
tawasRaEa fiI AlsRaxaMCi (assumed tropical:) [He took a wide, or an ample range, or was profuse, in bounty, or munificence]. (S, K, in art. xrq.)

s.hi: It expanded itself, spread out, dilated, widened.

sense.s: He expatiated. One says, twsRE fiI AldRaAri, and lahu saAHapN ytwsRE fiyhaA. (TA, voce trkRH.)
He strode, in walking.

tawasRaEuwA fiyhi HatRaI OaTolaquwhu EalaI kacaA They extended its (a word's) signification, or amplified in respect of it, or rather, took an extended range in using it, so that they applied it to such a thing. (The lexicons, &c., passim.)
tawasRaEa: see tabaqRara.
8. AitRasaEa It (a man's state, or condition, &c.) became free from straitness, or unstraitened.
AitRasaEa EayoXuhu [His means, or circumstances, of life became ample, or plentiful]. (Msb, art. nEm.)
AitRasaEa It widened, became wide, dilated, or expanded.

s.hi: His belly became wide, or distended.

sense.s: AitRasaEa liOamorK He was capable of doing a thing. An instance occurs in the TA, voce Oawohaba.
AitRisaAEu AlbiYori i. q. jiraAbuhaA [The interior of the well]. (K, art. jrb.) See also 5, in art. Eqd.
AitRasaEa Alxaroqu EalaI AlrRaAqiEi The hole was wide to the pitcher: see xaroqN.
AitRisaAEN Extension of the signification of a word or phrase: an amplification. (The lexicons, &c., passim.)
saEapN Width; breadth; extent, or space, from side to side. See sadiylN.
saEapN AlEayoXi Ampleness of the means, or circumstances, of life; an unstraitened, or a plentiful, state of life.

saEapN [Ample scope for action, &c.: and a state in which is ample scope for action, &c.: see nafasN, and miEoraADN:] richness, or wealthiness, or competence: and capacity, or power, or ability: (S, K:) and plentifulness and [consequently] easiness of life. (TA.)
saEapu AlSRadori i. q. saEapu Alxuluqi. (Har, p. 194.)
laka Eanohu saEapN: see rudoHapN.
yajuwzu fiI AlsRaEapi It is allowable absolutely, in other cases than those of poetical necessity. (IbrD.)
wasaAEN A horse wide in step: (S, K:) or i. q. jawaAdN. (K.)
wasiyEN, pl. wisaAEN: see OariyDC in art. OrD.
EayoXN waAsiEN A life ample in its means or circumstances; unstraitened, or plentiful.
waAsiEN Having power, or ability: (Bd, iv. 129:) or rather, having ample power or ability; powerful. See Ham, p. 609.
nafosN waAsiEN: see raAbiTN.
xuluqN waAsiEN (assumed tropical:) A large, or liberal, disposition: see baArijN.
waAsiEu Alxuluqi (tropical:) Large, or liberal, in disposition.
waAsiEu AlSRadori: see majamRN.
waAsiEu AljaroIi (S voce sahobN, applied to a horse,) Widestepping [in running]. (So expl. in the PS.)
OawosaEu Wider, or widest: see 3 in art. xlT.
muwasRaEN Ealayohi Amply, or abundantly, provided with the means of subsistence.
mutRasaEN Width; extent; ampleness of space, and of quantity: properly a place of width, or spaciousness. See nufosapN and mabosaTN.
wasoqN A camel's load: see wiqorN.
wasiyqapN A mob of driven cattle: see sayRiqahN and miEotaAqN.
1: see 5.
2: see 5.
5. tawasRala biAldRalowi UilaI AlmaMCi [He sought to get at, or obtain, the water by means of the bucket]. (M in art. dlw.)

tawasRala Uilayohi bikacaA He sought to bring himself near to him, or to approach to him, to gain access to him, or to advance himself in his favour, by such a thing: (Msb, &c.:) so too wasRala↓; (S, K;) and wasala↓, aor. yasilu. (Msb.)

wasiylapN A means of access to a thing; (IAth;) a means of becoming near to a thing: (IAth, Msb:) these are the primary significations: (IAth:) a means of becoming near to, or intimate with, or of ingratiating oneself with, another: (S:) honourable rank or station with a king: degree: affinity: (K:) a tie, or connexion: (TA:) it may be rendered a means of access, nearness, intimacy, ingratiating oneself, attachment, or connexion: and also, of attainment, or accomplishment.
1. wasama AlvRawoba [He marked, or put a mark on, the garment, &c.]; said of a trader, or dealer. (JK in art. rqm.)
wasamahu biAlhijaMCi [He branded him, or stigmatized him, with satire]. (TA.) See a hemistich cited voce XakiIRN.
wasamahu He marked it [in any manner]. (Msb.)
wasamahu biAlqawoli (tropical:) He stigmatized him, or set a mark upon him whereby he should be known, by something said. (TA in art. ElZ.)
wasamotu AlkitaAba [I put a superscription, or title, to the book, or writing.] (TA in art. Enw.)
wasuma, inf. n. wasaAmapN (S, Msb, K) and wasaAmN, (S, K,) He (a man, S) was beautiful in face: (S, Msb:) or bore the impress, or stamp, of beauty. (K.)

5. tawasRamotu fiyhi Alxabora i. q. tafarRasotuhu; (S;) [I discovered, or perceived, in him good, or goodness, by right opinion formed from its outward signs;] originally, I knew its real existence in him by its outward sign. (MF.) See also Har, pp. 30, 46, 76.
tawasRama He examined deliberately in order to know the real state or character of a thing by the external sign thereof. (Bd, xv. 75.)
He perceived a thing by forming a correct opinion from its outward signs. (TK.)

simapN A brand, or mark or figure made with a hot iron, upon an animal. (K.) And i. q. EalaAmapN [A mark, sign, badge, token, symptom, &c.]. (Msb.) And The EulowaAn [or title] of a book or writing. (TA in art. Elw.) See also siymapN and siymaI in art. swm.

wasoimapN [now applied to Woad]: i. q. EiZolimN, with which one tinges or dyes [the hands, &c.]: (S:) a certain plant, with the leaves of which
one tinges or dyes [the hands, &c.]; and said to be the EiZolim: (Msb:) the leaves of the niyl [or indigo-plant]: or a plant [of another species (TA)] with the leaves of which one tinges or dyes [the hands, &c.] (K.)
AlwasomiIRu: on the rain thus called, see nawoCN.
mawosimN [A periodical festival: a fair:] i. q. EiydN. (Msb, art. Ewd.)
mawosimu AlHaAjRi The fair, and place of meeting, of the pilgrims. (Mgh.)
miysamN A brand, or mark made with a hot iron. (TA, voce xidaAdN.)
[Originally] A branding, or cauterizing, instrument [or iron]; (S, K;) a marking instrument. (Msb.)
An impress, or a character, of beauty. (S, K.) See an ex. in a verse cited voce Oavima.
3. waAsaI: see Msayotuhu, throughout.
4. OawosaI, originally OasowaI: see AisotawaI
6. tawaAsawoA: see its syn. taMsawoA.
waXiyZN [thus without p]: see SamiymN.
waXiyEapN A ball of spun thread. (AA, TA in art. sHl.)
8. AitRaXaqa: see tajabojaba.
waXiyqapN: see jubojubapN.
3. yuwXiku Oano yakuwna It will soon be: (S, Msb, K, TA:) or it is near to being. (Msb, TA.)
waXokaAnN an anomalous inf. n., or perhaps a simple subst.: see 1 in art. XnO.
waXiykFA Quickly, or speedily. (IB, TA.) See an ex. in a verse cited voce taArapN.
waXalN: applied to water: see an ex. voce sajaEa; and another in a verse cited voce daqalN; and another voce raAXiHN.
waXuwlN A she-camel whose milk lasts throughout the year. (IAar., in TA, art. Xkr.)
4. OawoXama fiyhi, said of hoariness, It became abundant, or spread: see 5 in art. snm.
8. AitRaXamato biAlnRaWuwri [She tattooed herself with smoke-black]. (T, art. nwr.)
waXomN Tattoo: see OasafRa and qarRaHa.
waAXimapN A female tattooer. See rajaEa, latter part of the paragraph.
muwaXRamN [Tattooed]: see a verse cited voce TafolN.
1. waXaI, inf. n. waXoIN, He variegated, or figured, a piece of cloth, or a garment; (Mgh, Msb, * K;) and embellished it. (K.)
waXaI bihi UilaI AlsRuloTaAni, (S, K,) or Einoda AlsRuloTaAni, (Msb,) He calumniated, or misrepresented, him to the Sultán. (S, Msb, K.)
XiyapN Any colour differing from the main colour of a horse, &c.; a colour differing from the rest, (S,) or from that which generally pervades a thing.

s.hi: It is of one generally pervading colour, in which is no other colour.

sense.s: XiyapN [also] A mark, sign, symptom, or token, by which a thing is known; syn. EalaAmapN; (Msb;) and maxiylapN, which see.
waXoIN, originally an inf. n., A kind of variegated, or figured, cloth, or garment. (Mgh, Msb. *)
waXoIN The variegation, figured work, or figuring, of a garment; making it partycoloured.
waXI sometimes signifies A natural diversity of colours: see rumolapN.
waXoIN of a sword: see firinodN.
XiyawiIRN: see what next follows.
waXawiIRN rel. n. of XiyapN, the rad. w being restored; (S in the present art.;) and so XiyawiIRN↓, like EidawiIRN [of EidapN]. (S in art. wEd.)
qawolN mawoXiIRN bihi [A saying misrepresented]. (TA in art. qt, in an explanation of qawolN maqotuwtN.)
mawoXiIRN is used by Aboo-Dhu-eyb to signify A musical reed-pipe. (TA, art. nwb.)
1. waSufa He attained to the proper age for service. (K.) See an ex. in the K, voce muxalRaduwna.
4. OawoSafa and AisotawoSafa↓ He (a boy) became of full stature, and fit for service. (Mgh.)
8. AitRaSafa biAlEilomi [He was, or became, characterized, or he characterized himself, by knowledge, or science]. (Msb in art. OaholN.)

SifapN A quality; an attribute; a property; or a description, as meaning the aggregate of the qualities or attributes or properties of a thing; or the state, condition, or case, of a thing. So explained voce SinofN, and voce SuwrapN. See its syn. HaAlN.
SifapN in grammar, The same as naEotN, An epithet. (K.)

A word denoting an attribute (maEonFI) and a substance (caAt). Under this term are comprised the Asm fAEl, the Asm mfEwl, the Sfp mXbRhp, and the AfEl AltfDyl. (I'Ak, sect. AlSfp AlmXbRhp bAsm AlfAEl.)
SiqapN muXabRahapN [A simple epithet]; an epithet resembling an Asm fAEl.

s.hi: An epithet in which the substantive character predominates.

sense.s: SifapN, as a general term for an attributive word, is also applied by Lth and other old writers to An adverbial n. of place or time, and to a preposition. It is so applied in the L and TA, art. Enl, &c. It was applied to the former by Fr, (T, voce ZarofN,) and to the latter also. (L, TA, ubi supra.)
bayoEu AlmuwaASafapi: see 3 in art. rwD.
1. waSalahu, and waSala Uilayohi, He, or it, arrived at, came to, reached, attained, him, or it; (S, K, &c.;) as also Uilayohi tawaSRal↓. (M.)
waSala raHimahu He made close his ties of relationship by behaving with goodness and affection, &c., to kindred: see Silapu AlrRaHimi.
waSalahu and waASalahu↓ He had, or held, close, or loving, communion, commerce, or intercourse, with him. (Msb, K.)
waSalahu, inf. n. waSolN and SlapN; and waASalahu↓, inf. n. muwaASalapN and wiSaAlN; are said with relation to love, whether chaste or unchaste. (M, K.)
And waSala Habolahu, inf. n. waSolN and SilapN; and Habolahu waASala↓: [He made close his bond of love, by affectionate conduct]. (M.)
waSalahu He gave him property. (TA.) And waSalahu bijaAYizapK [He gave him a gift]. (K in art. Hcf.)
waSala He connected, or conjoined, a word with a following word, not pausing after the former; he made no interruption.
2. waSRalahu, inf. n. tawoSiylN, He joined, or connected, much: he made a string to have many joinings. (TA: the latter from an explanation of the pass. part. n.)

waSRalahu Uilayohi He made it to reach it, or him: syn. OanohaAhu Uilayohi, and Oabolafahu
UiyRaAh; like Uilayohi OawoSalahu↓ [q. v.]. (TA.) See an ex. voce gfala.
3: See 1.
waASala AlSRiyaAma, inf. n. muwaASalapN and wiSaAlN, He continued the fasting uninterruptedly. (TA.)
waASala: see waAtara.
waASala AlmaroOapa He held communion, or commerce, of love with the woman.
waASalaA Contr. of qaATaEaA. (K in art. qTE.)
4. OawoSalahu He made, or caused, him, or it, to reach; he caused to come, brought, conveyed, or delivered, him, or it; (S, * M, K, *) Uilayohi to him, or it; as also waSRalahu↓. (M.) See OadRaAhu.
5. twSRl Uilayohi He applied himself with gentleness, or courtesy, to obtain access, or nearness, to him. (S.) See 1.
8. AitRaSala bihi It communicated with it. (Modern usage.)
waSolN Union [of companions or friends or lovers]; contr. of firaAqN (T, S, voce bayonN) or of furoqapN (Msb, ibid.) or of faSolN (Bd in vi. 94) or of hijoraAnN. (S.)

s.hi: In the case of connexion with a following word and in the case of a pause.

sense.s: wiSolN and wuSolN↓ A limb: see faxicN and faEomN; and see also Har, p. 346. Between every faSolaAni [or rather between every faSol and the faSol next to it] is a wiSol. (O, K, in art. fSl.)
wuSolN: see wiSolN.

Silapu AlrRaHimi (tropical:) The [making close one's ties of relationship by] behaving with kindness, or goodness and affection and gentleness, and considerateness, or regard for their circumstances, to kindred, or relations, even though remote, or evil-doers: and qaToEu AlrRaHimi signifies the contr. (IAth, TA.)
SilapN A gift for which no compensation is to be made; a free gift; a gratuity; like hibapN and SadaqapN. (Marg. note in a copy of the KT.)
SilapN The connexion of a verb with the objective complement, whether immediate or by means of a preposition.
SilapN The complement of a mawoSuwl [or conjunct], (I have thus rendered it voce Oalo,) whether the latter be a particle or a noun. (I' Ak, sect. AlmawoSuwlu.)

[The term SilapN is also applied in the Msb, art. Ocn, to lahu in the phrase maOocuwnN lahu.] Often applied to the connective prep. by which a verb or act. part. n. is transitive, together with the noun or pronoun governed by it; as to lahu in Oacana lahu: and that prep. alone is called Harofu AlSRilapi. Also, to a prep. by which a pass. verb or part. n. is connected with its subject, together with that subject; as lahu in Oucina lahu. In this case it is an inf. n. in the sense of a pass. part. n., namely, of mawoSuwlN. (IbrD.)

[SilapN A connective word or phrase: as yakado is said to be in the phrase lamo yakado yaraAhaA: see art. kwd. In this case it is an inf. n. used in the sense of an act. part. n.] It is used in this sense especially with reference to cases in the Kur-án. (MF, art. kwd.)
wuSolapN: see EuloqapN: A means of connexion, or attachment: see cariyEapN.
mawoSilN A joint, or place of juncture.

mawoSuwlN, in grammar, [A conjunct]. This is of two kinds; mawoSuwlN HarofiIRN and mawoSuwlN UisomiIRN. The former term [or conjunct particle] is applied to the infinitive particles Oano, OanRa, kaI, lawo, and maA. The latter term [or conjunct noun] (I have thus rendered it voce Oalo, and voce Uino, and voce UinRa) is applied to the conjunctive nouns OalRaciI, and its fem. AalRatiI, and mano, and maA, and cuw in the dial. of Teiyi, and to Aalo, which last some incorrectly hold to be a conjunct particle, and others assert to be a determinative particle and not a conjunct, and to caA after the interrogative maA or mano. (I' Ak, sect. AlmawoSuwlu.)
UisotivonaMCN mutRaSilN An exception in which the thing excepted is united in kind to that from which the exception is made; contr. of munoqaTiEN.
2. waSRaAhu and OawoSaAhu↓ He enjoined him; charged him; bade him; ordered him: (K, &c.:) he commanded him, bikacaA, to do such a thing. (Msb.)
4. OawoSaI lahu biAlvRuluvi He bequeathed to him the third of the property. (MA.)

s.hi: He made his will.

sense.s: See 2.
6. tawaASawoA They enjoined, charged, bade, ordered, or commanded, one another. See an ex. voce tabaAEavuwA.
waSiIRN A person commissioned; a commissioned agent: (K:) an executor appointed by a will.

waSiyRapN An injunction, a charge, bidding, order, or command: (K:) an admonition, with an endeavour to persuade: and a command: its place may be supplied by any word in which is the meaning of OamorN. (Msb.)
And A will, or testament. (K, * TA.)

1. waDaEahu He put it, or laid it, (KL, * PS,) in, or on, a place: (PS:) he put it, or threw it, down from his hand: (TA:) contr. of rafaEah: (Mgh:) syn. HaTRahu: (K, * TA, in art. HT:) but it has a more general sense than this last. (Er-Rághib, Kull.)
waDaEa He put down a thing: contr. of rafaEa. (K, voce naSaba.)

s.hi: She brought forth.

sense.s: waDaEa lahu He appointed to him, or for him, a sign, or token, &c.: see Msb in art. Elm.
waDaEa Ealayohi He imposed upon him a fine, or tax, &c.
waDaEa He remitted a tax or the like; did not exact it. (Mgh, Msb, in art. jwH.)
waDaEuwA AlHaroba (assumed tropical:) [They gave over, or relinquished, war;] they made peace; opposed to rafaEuwhaA. (Ham, pp. 179 and 180.)
waDaEa minohu, (S,) or Eanohu, (K,) He lowered his grade, rank, condition, (S, K,) or estimation. (K.)
wuDiEa fiI tijaAratihi He lost, or suffered loss or diminution, in his traffic; (S, Mgh, Msb, K;) did not gain in it; (Mgh;) as also OuwoDiEa↓. (Mgh.)
waDaEa He forged (a word:) he forged (poetry, ElI in the name of). (Mz, 8th nwE.)
waDaEa lafoZFA liXaIoCK He applied or assigned or appropriated a word, or phrase, to denote, or signify, a thing. (Kull, 371, &c.) See also UizaMC.
waDaEotu Ealayohi AlXRaIoCa app. signifies I made the thing according to his, or its, measare. See qadarotu.
2. fiI fulaAnK tawoDiyEN: see TuroqapN.
4: See 1.
mino Oayona OawoDaEa AlrRaAkibu i. q. mn Ayn OawoDaHa. (T, in L, art. wDH.)
6. tawaADaEa He was, or became, lowly, humble, submissive, or in a state of abasement: (Msb:) or he lowered, humbled, or abased, himself. (S, K.)
tawaADaEaA AlrRuhuwna They two laid bets, wagers, or stakes, each with the other; syn. taraAhanaA. (TA, art. rhn.)
tawaADaEati AlOaroDu (tropical:) The land was lower than that which was next to it. (TA.)
8. AitRaDaEato OarokaAnuhu: see R. Q. 2 in art. DE.
waDoEN, as one of the ten predicaments, or categories, Collocation, or posture.
Also The constitution of a thing; its conformation; its make. And i. q. qanRN, meaning A mode, or manner, &c.
DaiEapN perhaps an inf. n. of waDaEato, meaning “ she brought forth: ” see 1, third sentence, in art. qrO.
waDiyEN Low, ignoble, vile, or mean; of no rank, or estimation. (Msb.)

s.hi: He is the depository of my secret, or secrets.
Same as

sense.s:
mawoDiEN The proper application, or
meaning, of a word. (Bd, iv. 48 and v. 45.) See 1 in art. Hrf. And The case in which a word is to be used: see S, art. on the particle fa.
And The proper place of a thing.

Ground; as when one says, “ a ground for, or of, belief, trust, accusation, ” &c. And The proper object of an action, &c.: as in the phrase fulaAnN mawoDiEN liloUikoraAmi Such a one is a proper object of honouring.
mawoDuwEN A certain pace of a beast; contr. of marofuwEN. (S in art. rfE.)
mawoDuwEN as an inf. n., signifying a certain manner of going of a beast: see rafaEa AlbaEiyru.
mawoDuwEN, in logic, (assumed tropical:) A subject, as opposed to a predicate: and (assumed tropical:) a substance, as opposed to an accident: in each sense, contr. of maHomuwlN.
(assumed tropical:) The subject of a book or the like.
See maSonuwEN.
OaSowaAtN maSuwgapN mawuDuwEapN: see art. Swg.
muwaADaEap [when used as a conv. term in lexicology] i. q. UiSoTilaAHN [when so used]. (Mz, 1st nwE.)
OakamapN mutawaADiEapN [(assumed tropical:) A low hill]. (S in art. xXE.)
4. OawoDafa AlnRaAqapa He made the she-camel to go the pace termed xabab; like OawofaDahaA. (Khaleefeh El-Hoseynee, in TA, art. wfD.)

waDiynN A girth (biTaAn) wide, woven of thongs or hair, or only of skin; (M, K;) said to be adapted for the raHol and the hawodaj; the biTaAn being peculiarly for the qatab: (M:) or it is for the hawodaj, like the biTaAn for the qatab and the taSodiyr for the raHol and the HizaAm for the saroj; and both [but to what this refers is doubtful] are like the nisoE, except that they are of thongs woven one upon another, doubly or more. (S.)
miyDanapN i. q. qufRapN i. e. marojuwnapN. (TA in art. Dwn.)
1. waTasa: see TaAsa in art. Tws.
2. waTRana nafosahu EalaI AlOamori He disposed and subjected his mind, or himself, to do the thing; syn. mahRadahaA lifiEolihi wacalRalahaA (Msb.)
wZRn nfsh ElI AlXRaIoCi, and lahu, He induced, or persuaded, himself to do the thing; syn. HamalahaA Ealayohi. (ISd, in TA.) See also 5 and 10.

5. tawaTRanato nafosuhu EalaI AlXRaIoCi, and lahu, He undertook the thing, and submitted to it; syn. taHamRalato wacalRato lahu (ISd, in TA) [see also 2 and 10] his mind, or he, became disposed and subjected to do the thing; syn. tamahRadato. (K [in the CK, for tawaTRunahaA tamahRudahaA, is put tawaTRanahaA tamahRadahaA].)
10. AisotawoTana He took for himself as a home, or settled place of abode, (S, Msb, K,) a country; (S, Msb;) as also OawoTana↓ (S, Msb, K) and waTRana↓ (S, K) or tawaTRana↓. (Msb.)
waTanN The place of abode or residence (S, Mgh, K) of a man: (S, Mgh:) a man's settled place of abode; his place of constant residence; his dwelling; his home. (Msb)
2. waZRafa Ealayohi AlEamala He appointed him the work. (Msb.)
waZRafa Ealayohimu AlxaraAja [He assessed them their rates of the xrAj]. (Mgh in art. qsT.)

waZiyfN, in every quadruped, What is above the rusog [or pastern], to the joint of the saAq: in the fore-leg of a horse, what is beneath the knee, to the jubRap; and in the hind-leg, what is between the kEb [or hock] and the jubRap: accord. to IAar, in a camel, from the rusg [or pastern], to the knee in the fore-leg, and in the hind-leg to the Euroquwb [or hock]: (M, TT:) [the shank, fore and hind].
See jubRapN, and HawoXabN, and rukobapN.

In a horse, What corresponds to the kuraAEN in an ox or sheep or goat; or the slender part of the leg. (K, voce krAE.) (The mawoSilu AlwZyfi is The joint between which and the hoof is the slender part called the rusogN. (K, art. rsg.) The slender part of the cirAE and saAq in a horse, camel, &c. (S, K.) That which is broad, in the hind-leg, is preferred; and that which is gibbous in the foreleg. (S.) [In art. jubRap, the place where the sAq and wZyf meet is mentioned.] The arm (cirAEN) of a camel, [&c.,] is above the wZyf. (K, voce ciraAEN.) The wZyf evidently signifies what anatomists call the metacarpus (in the fore-leg) and the metatarsus (in the kind-leg): see rkbp and kaEobN. In general it seems to signify the slender part of the shank, next the pastern: and this, accord. to the explanation of musotadaqRN in the M and K, is the meaning assigned to it in the S and K. See also ciraAE.]
The bone of the saAq. (L, art. zj.)
mawoSilu AlwaZiyfi The fetlock-joint. (S, K, voce rusogN.)
waZiyfapN A daily allowance, or portion, of food, or the like. (S, K.)
waZiyfapN also An appointed part-payment, or instalment, due at a particular period. (Mgh, Msb, in art. njm.)
waZiyfapN mino xaraAji AlOaroDi [An assessed rate of the land-tax]. S, voce TasoqN.)
waEowaEN: see furaAniqN.
1. waEasahu AldRahara i. q. HanRakahu and Earakahu and naHRadahu &c. (IAar, TA, in art. Hnk.)
wuEaAqN: see EuwaAqN.
waEiyqN: see EawiyqN.
waEoilN A mountain-goat: (K, &c.:) see vayanalN; also OalobN; and OarowiyRapN and XahorN.
wuEuwlN as meaning Noble persons: and strong men: see two exs. voce taHot.
1. waEaAhu He kept it in mind, and considered it. (Msb.)
waEaI AlHadiyva He kept, or retained, the narration in his mind, or memory; or knew it, or learned it, by heart; and studied it until he knew it. (Msb.)

waEaI, aor.
waEiIa
, He heeded; paid attention to.
4. OawoEaAhu AlHadiyva He made him to retain the narration in his memory; or to know it, or learn it, by heart. (TA, in art. zkt.)
wiEaMCN A [bag, or wallet, or] receptacle, for travelling-provisions, and for goods or utensils, &c.: (S, MA:) a vessel (?).
wiEaMCu Alqalobi [The pericardium]. (TA, voce fuWaAdN.)
batavotu lahu maA fiI wiEaAYiI (assumed tropical:) I showed him what was in my heart. (Er-Rághib, TA, in art. Xkw and XkI.)
Harofu AlwiEaMCi [The adverbial particle fiI]. (IB, in TA, art. wsT.)
4. OawogalotuhaA, for Aawogalotu fiyhaA: see a verse cited voce gamRN.
waAgilN: see waAriXN, and XaTana, and TafaA.
wagomN, said of food: see fagomN.
2. wafRaDa AlrRaHaI He put a wifaAD [or skin] beneath the [hand-] mill. (M, in art. vfl.)
4. OawofaDa: see OawoDafa.
wifaADN: see 2, and vifaAlN.
1. wafiqa Oamoruhu His affair, or case, was right, agreeable with what was wished, or desired. (A, TA.)
2. wafRaqa Oamorahu [He accomodated, adapted, or disposed, his affair to its object; directed it to a right issue;] prospered it. (TK.)
wafRaqahu liOamorK He disposed him, or adapted him, to a thing; he disposed him, or made him fit, for a thing.

wafRaqahu QllRehu God accommodated him, adapted him, or disposed him, or directed him, to the right course; syn. sadRadahu: (Msb:) God made him to take, or follow, a right way, course, or direction, [in an affair]: or directed him by inspiration to that which was good, or to prosperity. (TA.)
wafRaqahu lilsRadaAdi [He accommodated, adapted, disposed, or directed him, to that which was right]. (K, art. sd.)

wafRaqa byn AlXRayoYayoni He effected an agreement, a harmony, a reconciliation, an accommodation, or an adjustment, between the two things. (MA.) And wafRaqotu bayona Alqawomi [I effected an agreement, a harmony, &c., between the people, or party; made peace between them]. (Msb, in art. SlH; &c.)

3. waAfaqahu He, or it, was conformable, or did conformably, to him, or it; was as he, or it, was, or did as he, or it, did: coincided with him, or it: it suited him, or it: it matched it; tallied with it.
waAfaqahu EalaI OamorK i. q. maEahu AitRafaqa↓ Ealayohi, He agreed with him, or was of one mind or opinion with him, upon, or respecting, a thing, or an affair. (TA.)

[waAfaqahu is best rendered He agreed, consented, accorded, or was of one mind or opinion, with him: and he complied with him, or it (see TaAwaEahu): and he coincided with him, suited him, or it; it matched it, &c.]
waAfaqa AlEacaAbu AlcRanoba [The punishment agreed, or corresponded with the sin, crime, or offence]. (TA.)
waAfaqa It was suitable, or convenient.
See muXaAkalapN in art. Xkl, conj. 3.
waAfaqahu He encountered him; syn. with SaAdafahu, q. v.
4. Oawofaqa Oamorahu He found his affair, or case, agreeable with his wish, or desire. (TA.)
8. AitRafaqa It happened; chanced. So used in the K, art. lft, and in many other works.
AinRafaqa maEahu EalaI OamorK: see 3.
tawofiyqN A certain legal document: a pleading. See maHoDarN.

s.hi: Casual.

sense.s: 1. wafaI biAlEahodi biAlwaEodi [He fulfilled, performed, kept, or was faithful to, the compact, or covenant, and the promise]: act. part. n. wafiIRN; pl. OawofiyaMCu. (Msb.)
wafaMCN signifies The being faithful to an engagement, or promise: see 1, last sentence, in art. rEI.
wafaAhu He paid it: see an ex. (fiI vawobaIo OabiI Oano Oafiyahu) voce vawobN.

2. wafRaAhu HaqRahu and AwfAhu↓ and wAfAhu↓ and twfRAhu↓ and AstwfAhu↓ He paid, or rendered, to him fully, or completely, his right, or due. (K. [In the CK, AawofAhu is erroneously put for waAfaAhu.])
3. waAfaI bihi He brought it: see a verse cited in art. sjd.
See 2.

4. OawofaI Ealayohi He looked upon it, looked upon it from above, looked down upon it; got a view of it; or saw it; syn. OaXorafa Ealayohi, (S, Msb, K, TA,) and AiTRalaEa; and AwfI fiyhi [likewise] signifies AXrf. (TA.)
See 2.
5. tawafRaAhu QllRehu God took his soul, (S, K,) [either at death, or in sleep. See the Kur-án, vi. 60]: or caused him to die. (Msb.)
See 2 and 10.
10. AisotawofaAhu and tawafRaAhu↓ He [exacted,] took, or received, it fully, or wholly. (Mgh.) See an ex. voce EalaI.
See 2.
AisotawofaI [He completed] so many years of his age. (A, O, in TA, voce AHfr.)
wafiIRN: see wafaI.
wafiIRu AlEahodi [A fulfiller, performer, or keeper, of the compact, or covenant. (TA, voce UilRN.)
1. waqaEa AlOamoru The thing, or affair, [fell, befell,] happened; took place; came to pass; became [executed, performed, or] realized; syn. HaSala. (TA.)
waqaEa fiI He lighted, or came, upon a thing or place; and he became in a place.
waqaEuwA fiI AlsRunayRaAti AlbiyDi [They lapsed into the years of scantiness of herbage]. (K in art. snh, q. v.)
waqaEa Uilayohi It chanced, or happened, to come to him, or it: and, said of a thing borne by water, it drifted to it, namely, a place.
waqaEa Ealayohi It fell, lay, or closed, upon it, or against it.
waqaEa biAlOamori He originated the thing, or event, and made it to befall. (TA.)

s.hi: He fell into a snare, or the like: he became insnared.

sense.s: waqaEa fiI OaroDK falaApK i. q. SaAra fiyhaA [He was, or became, meaning he found himself, came to be, or chanced to be, in a desert, or waterless, land]; (Msb:) and fiI rawoDapK [in a meadow, or garden]: (T, S, in art. Anq:) [or he lighted upon, &c.; from the lighting of a bird].
yaqaEu followed by EalaI, often signifies It (a garment, &c., or a portion thereof,) lies against or upon a certain part of the body, &c.

waqaEa bihimo and bihimo OawoqaEa↓ He made much slaughter among them: (Msb:) or he fought them vehemently: (K:) or he fell upon them in fight: (PS:) both mean the same: (S:) he made an onslaught upon them: AwqE biAlEaduwRi he made an assault, or a sudden assault, upon the enemy. (MA.)
waqaEa fiyhi, inf. n. waqiyEapN, He spoke evil of him, behind his back, or in his absence, or otherwise, saying of him what would grieve him if he heard it; (S;) slandered him.
He reviled, vilified, or vituperated, him; charged him with a vice, fault, or the like; defamed him; or detracted from his reputation. (Msb.)

waqaEa mawoqiEFA mino kifaAyatihi, [and mino HaAjatihi, (see K, art. fqr,)] It supplied, or sufficed for, his need; syn. OagonaI ganaMCF. (Msb.) waqaEa mawoqiEFA signifies It stood in stead, or in some stead: see faqiyrN, in the K; and see Bd, and Jel, ix. 60: and mawoqiEFA EaZiymFA, in great stead.

lamo yaqaEo minohu mawoqiEFA [It did not stand with him in any stead]. (S, K, voce tasaxRaTa, end of art. sxT.) [You say] waqaEa minohu AlOamoru mawoqiEFA HasanFA OawosayRiYFA The thing stood with him [in good stead, or (if the expression be allowable) in evil stead]; syn. tabata ladayohi. (TA.)
waqaEa mawoqiEFA mina AlHaAjapi [It supplied, or sufficed for, what was needed]. (Bd, ix. 60.)
waqaEotu biqurRika, and biquHaAHi qurRika: see quHaAHN.
yaqaEu EalaI kacaA It (a word) applies to such a thing.

2. waqRaEa fiI AlkitaAbi, (MA, TA,) inf. n. tawoqiyEN, (KL, TA,) [as commonly used in the present day,] He signed the writing [for the purpose of giving effect to it, either beneath, or by endorsing it]: (MA, KL:) [but as generally used in earlier, though post-classical, times,] he annexed to the writing, after it had been finished, for the
Sultán or the administrator of affairs, to whom it had been submitted, something [for the purpose of giving effect thereto]; as, for instance, when a complaint is submitted to the Sultán or to the administrator, and one writes beneath the writing or on the back thereof, “ Let the affair, or case, of this person be looked into, and let his right, or due, be fully exacted for this person: ” or, accord. to Az, he wrote, upon the writing, a concise abstract, omitting redundances, of the objects of want [petitioned for therein]: from tawoqiyEu AldRabari Zahora AlbaEiyri [“ the gall's, or sore's, marking the back of the camel ”]; as though the muwaqRiE upon the writing marked, upon the case respecting which the writing was written, that which confirmed it, and rendered its execution obligatory: (TA:) tawoqiyEN also signifies such a writing itself (maA yuwaqRaEu fiI kitaAbKi; S, K, TA;) and its pl. is tawoqiyEaAtN: (TA:) it is said to be an Islámic term; not old Arabic. (TA.) [Also He made an entry of a note or postil or the like, or entries of notes, &c., in the writing, or book: see an ex. voce DiEof.
wqRE bihi He blamed him; reproved him angrily, or severely. (TA.)
See 4.

3. waAqaEa AlOamora (assumed tropical:) He threw himself [or plunged] into the affair: he fell into the affair: he fell into the affair, subjecting himself to difficulty. (MA.) And (assumed tropical:) He fell to the thing; such as eating, and drinking, and the like: see 3 in art. ftk, for an instance of this, as well as a similar, meaning.
waAqaEa AlOumuwra, inf. n. muwaAqaEapN and wiqaAEN, app., He was near to doing, or experiencing, the affairs, or events; syn. daAnaAhaA. (TA.)
waAqaEa XayoYFA also means He experienced the occurrence of a thing; he met with a thing; i. e., something occurred.
waAqaEa XayoYFA same as waqaEa fI XICK He fell into a thing. (Kur, xviii. 51, and Expos. of the Jeláleyn.)
waAqaEahaA He compressed her. (MA.)
waAqaEa bihimo [He engaged with them in fight, or conflict]. (S.)

4. OawoqaEa AlOamora, inf. n. UiyqaAEN, (with which tawoqiyEN↓ is syn., as is shown in the TA,) He made the thing, or affair, to happen, to take place, to come to pass, or to become executed or performed or realized.
OawoqaEahu He caused him to fall into a snare, or the like; he ensnared him.
OawoqaEa bihimo: see 1.

s.hi: He caused evil to befall them; occasioned them evil.

sense.s: OawoqaEa bihi [He punished him]. (A, art. Ecr.)
See 1.
OawoqaEa fiI qalobihi He put into his heart, or mind.
OawoqaEa bayona Alqawomi, (L, art. OrX,) or OawoqaEa bayonahumu AlXRarRa (TA, in that art.) i. q. OarRaXa. (L, TA, in that art.)
OawoqaEa He made a verb transitive.
5. tawaqRaEahu and AisotawoqaEahu↓ He expected it; looked for its coming to pass, or being. (S, K.)
waqiEN: see 8, in art. Hcw.
waqoEapN An onslaught; a shock in battle: (S:) or such as is repeatedly made. (K.)
waqiyEapN The wisp of wool, &c., with which one tars a mangy camel: see ribocapN.
waqRaAEN fiI AlXRarRi [app., One who is wont to make others fall into evil, or mischief]. (K, voce munodaASN, q. v., in art. dyS.)

s.hi: Actually occurring.
An event; a fact; a case.
In fact; in reality.

sense.s: UiyoqaAEN, in music, A cadence.
mawoqiEu UivomK An occasion (lit., a place) of falling into sin.
[waqaEa mawoqiEFA: see waqaEa, in three places: lit., It fell in a place of falling, or where it should fall: sometimes app. meaning it had an effect.]

It is said of a half of a date given as alms, laA yatabayRanu lahu mawoqiEN EalaI AljaAYiEi kamaA laA yatabayRanu EalaI AlXRaboEaAni UicaA Oakalahu [app., There appears not, of it, any effect upon the hungry, &c.]. (O, in art. wqE, in explanation of a trad. mentioned there and in the Msb.) See waqaEa mawaAqiEahu, voce Ealiqa.

s.hi: An efficient.

sense.s: muwaqRaEN Tried, experienced: see muwaqRaHN.
1. waqafa He was, or became, still, or stationary; (Msb;) [he stood still;] he continued standing: (K:) and [simply] he stood; contr. of jalasa. (TA.)
waqafa AldRaAbRapa, inf. n. waqofN, He made the beast to be, or become, still, or motionless. (Msb.)
waqafa Ealayohi He stopped, or paused, upon coming to him, or it; he stopped, or paused, at it; or where he, or it, was.

s.hi: He paused at, and paid attention to, a thing.

sense.s: waqafa Ealayohi He comprehended it, namely, a meaning: he understood it. (TA. [Or, correctly, wuqifa, for it is there altered.])
He met with it; namely, a word or the like, in reading: often occurring in this sense.
wuqifa Ealayohi He saw it: and he was introduced into it, and knew what was in it. (TA.) He was made to know it surely. See Bd, vi. 27 and 30.
waqafotuhu ElI canobihi I made him acquainted with, or made him to know, his crime, sin, fault, or the like; (S, K:) and so Ealayohi Oawoqafahu↓, q. v. (Mgh.)

waqafa, aor.
waqifa
, inf. n. wuquwfN, He withstood, resisted: governing by Eano.
waqafahu and Oawoqafahu↓ and waqRafahu↓ [He bequeathed it, or gave it, unalienably:] the first of these is the most chaste: the last is disapproved and rare. (TA, art. Hbs.) See muWabRadN.
2. waqRafahu EalaI AlOamori [He made him to pause, or wait, at the thing, or affair]. (K, TA, in art. vbT.) See the quasi-pass. tawaqRafa: and see vabRaTahu.
waqRafahu, inf. n. tawoqiyfN He taught him the places of pausing, in reading. (Mgh.) And hence, He made him to know a thing. (Mgh.)

waqRafahu EalaI AlXRaIoCi, meaning EarRafahu UiyRaAhu, He made him acquainted with the thing; informed him of it; gave him notice of it; though often occurring, for waqafahu Ealayohi, seems to be post-classical. It is used in this sense, or as meaning He (God) revealed to him the thing, in many places in the Mz, 1st nwE: as, for ex, in the following instance, cited from IF, waqRafa QllRehu Mdama EalaI maA XaMCa Oano yuEalRimahu UiyRaAhu [God taught, or revealed to, Adam what He pleased to teach him].
waqRafa AlHadiyva, (JK,) inf. n. tawoqiyfN, (K,) He explained the tradition; syn. bayRanahu. (JK, K. *)
tawoqiyfN, as a legal term: see naSRa EalaI XaIoCK mRaA.
See 1
3. waAqafa He stood with another in a competition; was a partner in a match, &c.: see rasiylN.
4: see 1.

s.hi: He acquainted him with a thing.

sense.s: Awqfth EalaI canobihi: see waqafotuhu, which is the expression commonly known.

5. tawaqRafa EalaI AlXRaIoCi (tropical:) He paused, or waited, at the thing; syn. talabRava. (IDrd, K, TA.) (Accord. to some copies of the K, tavabRata.] You say, tawaqRafotu EalaI hecaA AlOamori (tropical:) I paused, or waited, at this thing, or affair. (TA.) And tawaqRafa EalaI jawaAbi kalaAmihi (tropical:) [He paused, or waited, at the reply to his speech]. (TA.) And hence, tawaqRafa EalaI AlsRamaAEi He limited, or restricted, himself to what had been heard [from the Arabs, with respect to a construction, &c.]; did not transgress it, or overstep it. See mutawaqRafN.
tawaqRafa fiyhi (assumed tropical:) He paused upon it; he hesitated, or deliberated, respecting it. Of very frequent occurrence.
tawaqRafa Eani AlOamori (assumed tropical:) He held, refrained, or abstained, from the thing, or affair. (Msb.)

tawaqRafa EalaI kacaA It (for instance, an
opinion or a judgment, and the truth of an evidence or a demonstration, and the result of an inquiry or investigation) rested, was founded or grounded, depended, or was dependent, upon such a thing. You say, of knowledge, yatawaqRafu HuSuwluhu EalaI kacaA Its origination rests upon such a thing; as, for instance, speculation.
waqofN An entailed, or unalienable, legacy or gift; a mortmain. See Oaroqaba.
Alwuquwfu biEarafaAt The halting of the pilgrims at Mount 'Arafát.
HabiTa mawoqifu Alfarasi The horse's belly was inflated: see HabiTa.
mawoquwfu EalaI HadRi kuforK Brought to the verge of infidelity: see HadRN.
OanaA mutawaqRfN fI hecaA [I am pausing, or hesitating, respecting this;] I do not form, or give, a decided opinion (laA OumoDiI raOoyFA) respecting this. (TA.)
1. waqaAhu QllRehu AlsRuwoCa God preserved him from evil. (Msb.) See a verse cited voce naqaXa.
waqaAka AllRehu kulRa maHocuwr God preserve thee from all fear: see maHocuwrN.
qi, or qiho, and tawaqRa, are imperatives [meaning Be thou cautious]. (JK.)
qi EalaI ZaloEika: see ZalaEa.
waqaAhu and AitRaqaAhu↓ both signify He was cautious of it; syn. Hacirahu. (K.)
5. tawaqRaAhu (and, accord. to a usage in the K, art. Hrz, also tawaqRaI minohu) He guarded against it; was cautious of it; syn. AiHotaraza mnh and taHarRaza mnh. (S, K, * art. Hrz.)
tabaqRaho watawaqRaho: see 4 in art. bqI.
8. AitRaqI He preserved, or guarded, himself exceedingly, or extraordinarily: (Ksh, Bd in ii. 1:) he put a thing between him and another to preserve him, or guard him. (Ham, p. 359.)

In the conventional language of the law, He preserved, or guarded, himself exceedingly, or extraordinarily, (Ksh, Bd, ubi supra,) from sin, of commission or of omission, (Ksh,) [or] from what would harm him in the world to come. (Bd, who describes three degrees.) It may often be rendered He was pious; or careful of his religious duties.
AitRaqaI Ealayohimo waHacira [He guarded himself against them in an extraordinary degree, and was cautious, or wary]. (JK, TA, in art. xXI.) See 1.
yatoqiI, for yatRaqiI: see art. tqI: and see a verse of Khufáf Ibn-Nudbeh, (quoted in the S, in art. wqI,) cited voce OavorN.
yatRaqo for yatRaqi: see a verse cited voce mutaOawRibN.
waqiIRN Cautious, guarding himself from sin, &c.: see taqiIRN.
waqiyRapN Property by means of which one preserves himself: pl. waqiyRaAtN. (TA.) See a verse cited voce maHobalN.
wiqaAyapN Excess of preserving or guarding. (Ksh, Bd in ii. 1.)

s.hi: A preservative.

sense.s: waAqK A saddle that does not gall the back. (S, K.)
waAqiyapN used as an inf. n., like baAqiyRapN: see Har, p. 136.
waAqiyapN as meaning one preserver: see an ex. voce baAqiyapN.
OuwqiyRapN An ounce: see riTolN, in two places.
EakRa wakRa and EakRaI wakRaI: see art. Ek.
waAkiZN EalaI kacaA and muwaAkiZN i. q. waAZibN and muwaAZibN: Attending assiduously to such a thing; intent upon it. (Lh, in TA, art. wZb.)
wakaEapN pl. of wakiyEN, like as xabavapN is of xabiyvN, Base: see a verse cited voce OaHoSana.
1. wakafa said of water from the eyes: see a verse cited voce rasama. One of its inf. ns. is wakafaAnN. (K, voce jcRN.)
2. wukRifa EalaI Alxubozi [It was made to drip upon bread]; said of fat melting and dripping. (TA in art. jml.)
wakRafa and Oawokafa↓: see OakRafa and Mkafa.
4: see 2.
wakofN: see an ex. in a verse cited voce xayoTapN.
wakiyfN, inf. n. of 1: see risama.

1. wakalahu UilaI raOoyihi, inf. n. wakolN and wukuwlN, He left him to his opinion, or judgment. (TA.) And wakalotuhu UilaI nafosihi, aor. yakilu, inf. n. wukuwlN, [I left him to himself;] I did not manage his affair, nor aid him. (Msb.) And kiloniI UilaI kacaA Leave thou me to manage such a thing. (TA.)
wakalotuhu UilaI diynihi [I left him to his religion, not interfering with him therein]. (S, Msb, K, voce dayRanotuhu.)
2. wakRalahu biXaIoCK He appointed him, or intrusted him, as his commissioned agent, factor, or deputy, with the management, or disposal, of a thing.
wakRalotu bifulaAnK I associated a wakiyl [or factor, &c.] with such a one. (T in art. bi.)
5. tawakRala Ealayohi, and Elyh AitRakala↓, He relied upon him; (S, Msb;) and confided in him: (Msb:) he submitted himself to him. (K.)
tawakRala biAlOamori He became responsible to him for the management of the affair. (TA.)
tawakRala lahu bihi He became responsible to him for it. (TA.)

s.hi: He became
in an affair.
He became administrator of one's property.

sense.s: 6. tawaAkalahu He deserted him, or it: i. q. trkth: see two exs. voce sadirN.
8: see 5.
mutRakalN is used as an inf. n. of AitRakala.
wakalN and wukalapN↓ and tukalapN↓ An impotent man, (S, K,) who commits his affair to another. (S.)
wukalapN: see wakalN
tukalapN: see wakalN
wakiylN A witness; syn. XahiydN. (Jel, ii. 66; and iv. 169.)

s.hi: A commissioned agent; a factor; a deputy.

sense.s: wakaAlapN, for daAru AlwakaAlapi, A factory: pl. wakaAYilu.
wukonapN certainly means, sometimes, A bird's nest, wherever it be: see an ex. in the first paragraph of art. gdw.
wikaMCN A tie: see an ex. voce AisotN, in art. sth.
The tie, (S, Mgh, Msb, K,) which is a cord, (Msb,) of the head (S, Msb) of the qirobp, (S, Mgh, Msb, K,) &c. (K.)
R. Q. 1. walowalato She (a woman) wailed, or raised her voice with weeping. (Har, p. 395.)
3. waAlasa He acted perfidiously, or practised fraud: see daAlasa.
walosN Treachery: see dalRasa.
2. walRaEahu bihi [i. q. OawolaEahu bihi]: (K, art. grw:) He made him to be desirous, or fond, of it. See OagoraAhu bihi.
4. OawolaEahu bikacaA He, or it, rendered him eagerly desirous of such a thing; or fond of it. (MA.)
OawolaEahu bihi i. q. OagoraAhu bihi. (K.)

OawliEa bihi He became attached to it, or fond of it; [was devoted, or addicted, to it; was eagerly desirous of it;] he adhered, clung, or clave, to it; or loved it; (Msb;) i. q. OugoriIa bh. (S.) See this last, and Ougorima bihi.
waloEN Lying: see XaholN.
wuluwEN Eager desire [biXaIoCK for a thing]; syn. HiroSN: (Har, p. 607:) fondness [for it]; attachment [to it]: (L, Msb, TA:) i. q. garaAmN. (S, K, in art. grm.)
waliyE and waliyEap of the TaloE: see DaHokN.
muwalRaEN Marked, in oblong shapes, with black and white: (S:) or, with other colours. (As, S.) See also mulamRaEN.
1. walaga He (a dog) lapped. (S, Msb, K.) See an ex. voce maHosuwmN.
Alwalofu The common cyclamen: see baxuwru maroyama.
wilaAfN, for UilaAfN: see Oalifahu.
waliymapN A repast prepared on the occasion of a wedding: (T, S, M, Mgh, Msb, K:) or, on any occasion. (M, Mgh, K.)

1. waliha His reason departed, or he became bereft of his reason or intellect, in consequence of grief; (K;) or of joy, or grief; (Msb;) or of intense grief; (S, Mgh;) or of the loss of the beloved: (TA:) or he grieved, or sorrowed: (K:) and he became confounded, or perplexed, and unable to see his right course, (S, K, TA,) by reason of intense grief: (S, TA:) and he feared. (K.) See also Oaliha, in two places.
waliha UilaI OumRih He (an infant) yearned for his mother. (TA.) And waliha Uilayohi is app. syn. with Oaliha Uilayohi, q. v.
walahN Distraction in love: see HubRN.
waAlihN [Bereft of the beloved:] i. q. vaAkilN. (TA, art. Trb.) And Distracted.

1. waliyahu, (S, Msb, K,) and waliI Ealayohi, (Msb, K,) inf. n. wilaAyapN (S, Msb, K,) and walaAyapN, (K,) or the former is a simple subst., (TA,) and signifies the office, and authority, (K,) He held command or authority over it; had charge of it; presided over it, or superintended it, (namely a thing, S, Msb, K, and a country, province, town, or the like, S, Msb,) as a prefect, commander, governor, lord, prince, king, administrator, or manager; (K, TA;) i. q. tawalRaAhu↓. (Msb.)
waliIa kacaA He performed the act or office of doing such a thing; he did such a thing himself.
2. walRaI He caused to turn away, or back. (Kur-án, ch. ii. v. 136.)
He caused to turn towards, with acc. (Idem, ch. ii. v. 139.)
He turned away, or departed. (TA.)
walRaI Eanohu He turned away from, avoided, shunned, and left, him or it. (Msb.)
walRati AlHarobu [The war declined]. (A, K, in art. sfr.)
walRaI haAribFA He went back, or retreated, fleeing. (S.)
walRayotuhu ZahoriI I placed him behind me, and betook myself to defending him. (TA in art. Xzn.)
More commonly I turned my back upon him, or it: see Har, p. 564.
walRaI AllRayolu liyacohaba The night [declined, i. e.] retreated to depart; syn. Oadobara. (T in art. dbr.)
walRaI Oamoru Alqawomi lifasaAdi The case of the people, or party, declined, or became reduced to a bad state; syn. Oadobara. (M in art. dbr.)

[walRaI kibarFA, and walRaI alone, both of frequent occurrence in the lexicons, &c., He became in a declining state by reason of age.] walRaI said of a man is syn. with dabara; as also XayRaxa. (S in art. dbr.) See also two exs., p. 75, col. 3.
AltRawoliyapu, like AlUidobaAru, properly signifies Retrogression; and hence, like this English word, tropically, declension.
walRaAhu OamorFA He set him over the thing; appointed him superintendent of it; or set him to do it; as also UiyRaAhu OawolaAhu↓.
walRaI duburahu and walRaAhu duburahu; see duburN, and see three phrases voce canabN.
3. waAlaAhu It was next, or adjacent, to it. Said of one place or tract with respect to another.

waAlaI He made a consecution, or succession, of one to the other; (S, K;) bayonahumaA between them two; (S;) or bayona AlOamorayoni between the two things or affairs; he made a successive connexion, or no interruption. (K.) And wAlAh He made it consecutive, successive, or uninterrupted, in its progressions, or gradations, or the like; syn. taAbaEahu [which see]. (Msb.)
waAlaAhu, (MA,) inf. n. muwaAlaApN, (S, KL, TA,) He befriended him, or was friendly to him. (S, MA, KL, TA.) See XaAyaEahu.
4. OawolaI He gave: and he made near. (KL.)

OawolaAhu maEoruwfFA He did to him, or conferred upon him, a benefit, or favour; syn. OasodaAh Uilayohi; as though he made it cleave to him, being next to him: or he put him in possession of it. (TA.) You say also, OawolaAhu culRaA [He brought upon him abasement, or ignominy], (S, K, in art. xsf,) and AlcRulRa waAlhawaAna. (Msb in that art., voce xasofN, q. v.)
5. tawalRaI He turned himself, AlI towards. (Jel, ii. 139.) He turned away (Idem, xix. 50; and S, Msb) Eanohu from him, or it. (S.)
tawalRaI He turned the back to another: see a verse in art. fyl, conj. 1.

s.hi: He took upon himself an affair.

sense.s: tawalRaI kiborahu He took upon himself, or undertook, the main part thereof; syn. taHamRala muEoZamahu. (Jel, xxiv. ii.)
tawlRaAhu: see waliyahu.
10. AisotawolaI Ealayohi He mastered, or gained the mastery over, him or it; (Msb;) he got it in his hand, possession, or power. (TA.)
Uisotawolato Ealayohi AlHujRapu [The argument, allegation, or pled, overcame him]. (L in art. bht.)

waliIRN The manager of a thing, or of the affairs of another: (Msb:) the guardian, or manager of the affairs, and maintainer, of an orphan: the guardian of a women, who affiances her, and independently of whom marriage cannot be contracted by her. (TA.) The executor of a deceased person: (Bd, xvii. 35:) the heir of a deceased person. (Bd, Jel, ibid.) The hair [or next-of-kin] of a slain person, (Bd, Jel, xvii. 35,) who has the management of the affairs after the death of that person. (Bd, ibid.) And the slayer's next-of-kin, who is answerable for him.
waliIRu EahodK and wilaAyapu EahodK: see art. Ehd.

waliIR QllRehi may be rendered The friend of God: or waliIRN has the meaning of an act. part. n., i. e. the constant obeyer [of God]: or that of a pass. part. n., i. e. [the favourite of God;] the object of the constant beneficence and favours of God. (TA.) See EaduwRN.
OallRehu waliIRu AlHamodi signifies both musotaHiqRuhu and SaAHibuhu. (IbrD.)
waliIRN pl. OawoliyaACu A saint, &c.
waliIRN The rain after the wasomiIR. (TA in art. Enw.)
walaMCN Relationship: so in the phrase bayonahumaA walaMCN [Between them two is relationship]. (JM.)
Also used for OaSoHaAbu walaMCK: see a verse cited voce EayorN.
walaMCN The right to the inheritance of the property left by an emancipated slave.
wilaAyapN: see waliIRN.
waAlK A prefect, governor, ruler, king, regent, judge, magistrate, &c. See maEuwnapu.

fulaAnN OawolaI bikacaA Such a one is more, or most, entitled to such a thing; has a better, or the best, right, or title, or claim, to it; is more, or most, deserving, or worthy, of it; is more, or most, competent to it; is more, or most, fit for it; syn. OaHaqRu bihi. (Msb.) But see OaHaqRN. See also an ex. voce Ouwluw, from the Kur, viii., last verse, and xxxiii. 6.

s.hi: More worthy, or deserving, of a thing. More fit, apt, or proper, for a thing.

sense.s: biAlTRariyqi liOawolaI A fortiori: see TariyqN.
mawolFI A lord, or chief; syn. sayRidN. (TA in the addenda.)
The son of a paternal uncle: (S, Msb:) or a relation, (K,) such as a son of a paternal uncle (IAar, K) and the like, (K,) [i. e.] and such as a son of a sister. (IAar, TA.)

And A freedman; (S, Msb, K;) so called because he is in the condition of the son of a paternal uncle; being one [under the patronage of his emancipator, i. e.,] whom the emancipator is bound to aid, and whose property he inherits if he dies having no [natural or other legal] heir. (TA.) And (K) a slave: (M, K:) fem. with p. (M.)
mawaAliyaA, vulg. mawRaAl (not mawaAliyRaA) A kind of short poem, generally of five lines, of which all but the penultimate end with the same rhyme: see note 5 to ch. xxvi. of my “ 1001 Nights. ”
2. wamRaI and AisotawomaI↓: see wmO.

mawaAmK Lands wherein is nothing. (A'Obeyd, TA, in art. blq.) The pl., when indeterminate, is thus, not mawaAmiI. See a verse in art. ErI, conj. 12. [This is a correction of art. mwm, to which this word, and also the verb, belong: for there is no such root as wmI.]
1. wanaI fiyhi He entered upon a thing languidly; and Eanohu He passed from it: see Eano.
6. tawaAnaI He was, or became, languid, remiss, weak, feeble, or faint, (T, S, M, MA, Msb, K, *) in actions, and affairs, (T,) in respect of an object of his want, (S,) or in an affair. (MA, Msb.)
tawaAnaI fI AlOamori He flagged, or was remiss, in the affair; (Msb;) i. q. qaSRara. (S.)
wanaApN A woman languid, or gentle, or grave in deportment, &c.: see OanaApN.
miynaMCN A port: see an ex. in a verse cited voce XuHuwn: it is masc.; its being a substitute for I: or it is an ancient Egyptian word in origin.
tayohuwrN, originally wayohuwrN: see thr
xuco maA Oawohafa Take what is easily attainable; what offers itself without difficulty. (AA, in TA, voce Antdb.)
6. tawaAhaqato OaxofaAfuhaA: see migolaApN.

s.hi: The lasso.

sense.s: migolaApN Alwahaqi: see migolaApN, art. glw.
laqiytuhu OawRala waholapK I met him the first thing: see SawolapN.

1. wahima fiI AlHisaAbi, (S, Mgh, Msb, K,) aor. yawohimu, inf. n. wahomN, (S, Msb,) He committed an error, or a mistake, in the reckoning, or calculation; (S, Mgh, Msb, K;) as also fiyhi Oawohama↓: (Mgh, Msb:) and committed an inadvertence therein. (S.) [And in like manner, fiI qawolihi in his saying.] It is said in a trad. of 'Alee, UinRamaA AlsRaAdiqu hecaA qaAla AlXRaAhidaAni OawohamonaA↓ or wahimonaA accord. to different readings [The two witnesses said, We have committed a mistake, or misconception: the thief is only this]. (Mgh.)

wahamotu AlXRaIoCa, (Mgh, Msb, *) aor. Oahimu, inf. n. wahomN, (Mgh,) [I thought of the thing;] the thing occurred in my mind. (Mgh, Msb, *) And wahamotu fiI AlXRaIoCi, (S, K,) or UilaI AlXRaIoCi, (Msb,) aor. as above, (S, Msb, K,) and so the inf. n., (S, Msb,) I thought of the thing, (S, Msb, K,) while desiring to think of another thing. (S, Msb.)
2: see 4.
4. Oawohamahu He made him to think [or imagine a thing]; as also wahRamahu↓. (S, K.) Oawohamahu kacaA He made him to think, or suspect, such a thing. (MA.)
See 8.
Oawohama: see wahima.
Oawohama fiyhi also signifies He doubted respecting it. (Mgh.)
5. tawahRama is properly rendered He presumed, surmised, fancied, or supposed a thing: and tawahRumFA, upon presumption, surmise, or supposition; and suppositively: see wahomN; and xaAla and xaAlN.
tawahRama He thought; (S, K;) he imagined a thing: (TA:) he doubted: see an ex., in a verse of 'Antarah, cited voce mutaradRamN.

8. AitRahamahu bikacaA (Msb, K) and Oatohamahu bihi (AZ, K) and bihi Oawohamahu↓ (K) He made him an object of imputation, or suspected him, of such a thing; he imputed to him such a thing. (Msb, K, TA.) See art. thm.

Oatohamahu bikacaA, as also AitRahamahu bkcA, and bkcA Oawohamahu↓, He suspected him of such a thing; i. e., of a thing that was attributed to him. (Marg. note in K.) [This is the signification commonly obtaining. See an ex. in the TA, voce sixaAb.
Also, the second, He accused him of such a thing.]

wahomN A thought, or an idea, occurring in the mind: (Mgh, Msb, * K: *) pl. OawohaAmN: (Msb:) or of the two extremes [or different opinions or ideas] between which one wavers, that which is outweighed [in probability]. (K.) An [indecisive] opinion or idea outweighed in probability [or formed from evidence outweighed in probability; a presumption; a surmise; a fancy; a supposition]: opposed to ZanRN, q. v. (Kull, p. 376.)
Also Doubt, or suspicion: but for this I have found no authority; though it is well known, and plainly indicated in the Msb, in art. xyl; voce xayRala, q. v. in this Lex.

Also The object of a thought, or of an idea, occurring in the mind. (Mgh.) And The mind itself, or intellect; syn. EaqolN. (MF, TA.) In modern Arabic it signifies An imagination, a fancy, a chimera, and a conjecture.

1. wahana He was, or became, weak, or infirm, in an affair, and in operation, and in body; (Msb:) and so said of a bone: (Bd, and Jel in xix. 3:) and he was, or became, languid, languid and faint, or lax in the joints; (TA, Bd in iii. 140;) enervated, unnerved, or broken in energy; (Bd, ubi suprà;) cowardly. (TA, Jel in iii. 140.)
See also 4.
2: see 4.

4. Oawohanahu He, or it, weakened him: [rendered him languid, languid and faint, or lax in the joints; enervated him, unnerved him, or broke his energy; rendered him cowardly: (see wahana:)] (S, Msb, K:) and wahanahu↓, (S, Mgh, Msb, K,) but the former is the better, (Msb,) and wahRanahu↓. (S, K.)
wahonN The period about midnight; (S, K;) or the time after an hour, or a short period, (saAEap,) of the night: (JK, K, TA:) or when the night is departing. (S.) See UinoIN.
Eiroqu AlwaAhinapi The cephalic vein: see faliyqN.
wahonaAnapN I. q. wanaApN, q. v.; and see OanaApN.
tawahRunN Weak, languid, unable to rise: see EudawaMCu.
1. wahaI It was, or became, much slit, or rent. (Msb.)
It was, or became, lax, flaccid, or flabby: (Msb:) or weak; said of a rope, (Mgh,) or other thing: or it fell. (Msb.) See waAhK.
wahaiIa It was, or became, uncompact, unsound, or weak.
wahaI Oamoruhu [His affair, or case, was, or became, in a weak, or an unsound, state]. (TA, art.ngD, &c.)
waAhK Lax; weak: frail; wanting in strength, compactness, firmness, or toughness; unsubstantial; unsound. See an ex. in the S, voce OunoXuwTapN, where it is applied to love, or affection.
waAhFA: see an ex. voce nugobapN; and see Mhi, in art. Awh, in two places.
wayolapu and wayolFA lahu and wayolN lahu Woe to him! [See Eawolaka]. Perdition befall him! Punishment befall him! (Kull, p. 377.) See voce wayobN, and voce wayoHN, and wayosN.
wayohFA [an imperative verbal noun, which may be rendered On!] a word of incitement. (S, K.) One also says to a man, and to a horse, yaA wayohaAho [Ho! On!]. (A'Obeyd in TA in art. Ayh.) See OayRaha.
wayohaka: see Oayohaka in art. Ayh. I have not found this anywhere but in that art. in the K, and doubt its correctness.
